intro: Acnistus guayaquilensis, commonly known as the Guayaquil acnistus, is a shrub native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
